title: Actor’s ‘suicide attempt’ caught on CCTV
text:
Email a friend 
HE made a name for himself in the 90s playing one of Sarah Michelle Gellar’s sidekicks on Buffy the Vampire Slayer . 
But the past few years have been hard for Nicholas Brendon, with leaked CCTV footage of the actor’s attempt to take his own life in a public place being just the latest in a long line of troubling incidents. Fall from grace ... Nicholas Brendon’s mugshot from his September arrest Source: Supplied At his peak ... Nicholas Brendon as Xander in Buffy the Vampire Slayer Source: Supplied 
In exclusive footage obtained by Radar Online , 44-year-old Brendon appears to cut his left wrist twice before slumping on the ground outside of a popular bar in Saratoga Springs, New York. 
Brendon has slammed Radar Online for publishing the video in a public post on his Facebook page. 
A video was leaked today that I find egregious. As all of you know I am desperately battling depression and it is... 
“As all of you know I am desperately battling depression and it is unfortunate that others capitalise off my struggles,” he wrote in the Facebook post. 
“I have ups and downs but I am still a human being.” 
The footage is reportedly from a nine-day meltdown in September, in which Brendon had multiple run-ins with police. 
Brendon was arrested on September 30 after he reportedly assaulted his girlfriend. 
Saratoga Springs police Lt. Bob Jillson said Brendon allegedly grabbed his girlfriend “by the throat and started choking her”. 
The actor’s ongoing struggles with depression and alcohol abuse have been well-documented since Buffy the Vampire Slayer went off the air in 2003. 
Brendon was previously arrested at a comic book convention in May, and checked into rehab in June after his marriage fell apart. 
He made headlines earlier in the year when he made a public plea for help. — Nicholas Brendon (@NicholasBrendon) July 5, 2015 
Dr Phil invited the troubled actor on his show in September, but Brendon quickly left when he “went for the jugular”. 
“By no means am I a perfect person, but I am also not the monster as portrayed by this show. I am actively participating in treatment and remaining positive in the light of negativity,” Brendon wrote on Facebook at the time. 
But during his appearance on Dr Phil, Brendon revealed he had been arrested five times in eight months. Fan favourite ... Nicholas Brendon is famous with fans for his contagious sense of humour. Picture: Ric Frearson Source: News Corp Australia 
He started drinking at the age of 26 — around the time of filming season two of Buffy the Vampire Slayer – as a coping mechanism for his anxiety. 
“It goes from, ‘hey, I’m having fun’, to then I, literally, needed to have a drink before I could have a conversation with people. I knew by the end of ‘Buffy’ that things were a little out of control for me,” Brendon said on Dr Phil . Why Nicholas Brendon walked off Dr Phil
